subject: Hockey, Ice
Drug Abuse and Traffic
lead_paragraph: Defenseman Sean Hill, who became the first N.H.L. player suspended for violating the league’s drug policy last season, completed a one-year deal with the Minnesota Wild. Hill, 37, played for the Islanders last season. He was suspended for 20 games on April 20, hours before their playoff loss to Buffalo. He will miss the first 19 games this season.
